briefdescription.para: constructs the executor with N worker threads

detaileddescription.para: The constructor spawns N worker threads to run tasks in a work-stealing loop. The number of workers must be greater than zero or an exception will be thrown. By default, the number of worker threads is equal to the maximum hardware concurrency returned by std::thread::hardware_concurrency.

briefdescription.para: destructs the executor

detaileddescription.para: The destructor calls Executor::wait_for_all to wait for all submitted taskflows to complete and then notifies all worker threads to stop and join these threads.

briefdescription.para: runs a taskflow once

detaileddescription.para:
taskflow
a tf::Taskflow object
a tf::Future that holds the result of the execution This member function is thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: runs a moved taskflow once

detaileddescription.para:
taskflow
a moved tf::Taskflow object
a tf::Future that holds the result of the execution The executor will take care of the lifetime of the moved taskflow.
This member function is thread-safe.

detaileddescription.para:
taskflow
a tf::Taskflow object
callable
a callable object to be invoked after this run
a tf::Future that holds the result of the execution This member function is thread-safe.

a tf::Future that holds the result of the execution The executor will take care of the lifetime of the moved taskflow.
This member function is thread-safe.

a callable object to be invoked after this run completes
a tf::Future that holds the result of the execution The executor will take care of the lifetime of a moved taskflow.
This member function is thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: wait for all tasks to complete

detaileddescription.para: This member function waits until all submitted tasks (e.g., taskflows, asynchronous tasks) to finish.

briefdescription.para: queries the number of worker threads
queries the number of running topologies at the time of this call

detaileddescription.para: When a taskflow is submitted to an executor, a topology is created to store runtime metadata of the running taskflow.

briefdescription.para: queries the number of running taskflows with moved ownership
queries the id of the caller thread in this executor

detaileddescription.para: Each worker has an unique id in the range of 0 to N-1 associated with its parent executor. If the caller thread does not belong to the executor, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: runs a given function asynchronously

detaileddescription.para:
F
callable type
ArgsT
parameter types
f
callable object to call
args
parameters to pass to the callable
a tf::Future that will holds the result of the execution This method is thread-safe. Multiple threads can launch asynchronous tasks at the same time.
This member function is thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::Executor::async but does not return a future object

detaileddescription.para: This member function is more efficient than tf::Executor::async and is encouraged to use when there is no data returned.
This member function is thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: constructs an observer to inspect the activities of worker threads

detaileddescription.para:
Observer
observer type derived from tf::ObserverInterface
ArgsT
argument parameter pack
args
arguments to forward to the constructor of the observer
a shared pointer to the created observer Each executor manages a list of observers with shared ownership with callers. For each of these observers, the two member functions, tf::ObserverInterface::on_entry and tf::ObserverInterface::on_exit will be called before and after the execution of a task.
This member function is not thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: removes the associated observer

detaileddescription.para: This member function is not thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: queries the number of observers
class to create an executor for running a taskflow graph

detaileddescription.para: An executor manages a set of worker threads to run one or multiple taskflows using an efficient work-stealing scheduling algorithm.
All the run methods are thread-safe. You can submit multiple taskflows at the same time to an executor from different threads.
